result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Veronique Juliet Johnson

records.addlTxt: Per Letter to Court from Defense Counsel dated 10/10/2022 requesting adjourned status date, Court grants the 10/13/2022 status conference to be rescheduled to 11/11/2022 at 9:00 a.m. by Zoom.
to Court from Defense Counsel requesting adjournment, filed.

Defendant Veronique Juliet Johnson appeared by phone.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Veronique Juliet Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing by Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defense motion to withdraw; Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Veronique Juliet Johnson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Veronique Juliet Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel first appearance with client and requests additional time. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store andTotal Wine Spirits Beer & More.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch .
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Veronique Juliet Johnson in court.  Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Veronique Juliet Johnson not in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/28/22 @ 1p
